abstract: Vale, the Brazilian mining company, said Thursday that it would buy back up to $2 billion in shares, and that it planned to list its shares on the Hong Kong exchange.
snippet: Vale, the Brazilian mining company, said Thursday that it would buy back up to $2 billion in shares, and that it planned to list its shares on the Hong Kong exchange.
lead_paragraph: Vale, the Brazilian mining company, said on Thursday its cash generating ability would allow it to buy back up to $2 billion in shares and return to investors $2.75 billion over the next five months, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Vale Announces Buyback and Hong Kong Listing
